co.cask.cdap.api.data

Interface DatasetContext

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BatchActionContext, BatchAggregatorContext, BatchContext, BatchRuntimeContext, BatchSinkContext, BatchSourceContext, DataWriter, FlowletContext, HttpServiceContext, MapReduceContext, MapReduceTaskContext<KEYOUT,VALUEOUT>, SparkClientContext, SparkExecutionPluginContext, SparkPluginContext, WorkflowContext

    public interface DatasetContext
    This interface provides methods that instantiate or dismiss a Dataset during the runtime of a program. If the same arguments are provided for the same dataset, then the returned instance is the same as returned by previous calls.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void discardDataset(Dataset dataset)
      Calling this means that the dataset is not used by the caller any more, and the DatasetContext must close and discard it as soon as possible.

    • Method Detail

      • getDataset

        <T extends Dataset> T getDataset(String name)
                             throws DatasetInstantiationException
        Get an instance of the specified Dataset.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the Dataset
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Dataset
        Returns:
        An instance of the specified Dataset, never null.
        Throws:
        DatasetInstantiationException - If the Dataset cannot be instantiated: its class cannot be loaded; the default constructor throws an exception; or the Dataset cannot be opened (for example, one of the underlying tables in the DataFabric cannot be accessed).

      • getDataset

                               Map<String,String> arguments)

        Get an instance of the specified Dataset.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the Dataset
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Dataset
        arguments - the arguments for this dataset instance
        Returns:
        An instance of the specified Dataset, never null.
        Throws:
        DatasetInstantiationException - If the Dataset cannot be instantiated: its class cannot be loaded; the default constructor throws an exception; or the Dataset cannot be opened (for example, one of the underlying tables in the DataFabric cannot be accessed).

      • releaseDataset

        @Beta
void releaseDataset(Dataset dataset)
        Calling this means that the dataset is not used by the caller any more, and the DatasetContext is free to dismiss or reuse it. The dataset must have been acquired through this context using getDataset(String) or getDataset(String, Map). It is up to the implementation of the context whether this dataset is discarded, or whether it is reused as the result for subsequent getDataset(java.lang.String) calls with the same arguments. This may be influenced by resource constraints, expiration policy, or advanced configuration.
        Parameters:
        dataset - The dataset to be released.

      • discardDataset

        @Beta
void discardDataset(Dataset dataset)
        Calling this means that the dataset is not used by the caller any more, and the DatasetContext must close and discard it as soon as possible. The dataset must have been acquired through this context using getDataset(String) or getDataset(String, Map).

        It is guaranteed that no subsequent invocation of getDataset(java.lang.String) will return the same object. The only exception is if getDataset() is called again before the dataset could be effectively discarded. For example, if the dataset participates in a transaction, then the system can only discard it after that transaction has completed. If getDataset() is called again during the same transaction, then the DatasetContext will return the same object, and this effectively cancels the discardDataset(), because the dataset was reacquired before it could be discarded.

        Parameters:
        dataset - The dataset to be dismissed.
